main event: Several Air Force officers observed a silver, circular object hovering near Kirtland AFB on 23 May 1952.
interesting points: The object exhibited random motion and changed brilliance from bright to dim over the observation period., The object was located approximately 12 to 20 miles from the base and was observed using binoculars and a telescope., A flight was diverted to investigate but did not successfully identify the object., Witnesses believed it could be a balloon, aircraft, or paper but there was no conclusive identification., The object hovered for about 45 minutes before descending below the horizon.
sighted object: a silver circular object with a dome
witness description: Air Force officers from the 135th Aircraft Control and Warning Squadron
